failures.testName: PHASE 2: WHITE SCREEN: white screen wont load

expected.expectedTitle: Fix white screen or blank page not loading

sources.title: Fix white screen or blank page
sources.summary: A blank or white page usually means a browser compatibility issue or JavaScript error. Try refreshing, clearing cache, or using a different browser.

sources.title: What to do if you do not have a job description
sources.summary: You have three options: (1) Enter just the job title and we search Indeed for matching descriptions, (2) Use the Job Search page to find real listings and click Create Resume for This Job, or (3) Describe the role yourself. Real job postings produce better keyword matches than generic titles.

sources.title: What processing means and how long resume analysis takes
sources.summary: When you see 'Processing' after submitting, we are running SPOR analysis—parsing your resume, analyzing the job description, cross-referencing O*NET data, and generating your optimized resume. This typically takes 30-60 seconds. If stuck over 2 minutes, refresh the page.

sources.title: Fix white screen or blank page not loading
sources.summary: A blank page usually means a browser compatibility issue. Try: hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows, Cmd+Shift+R on Mac), clear browser cache, disable extensions (especially ad blockers), try Incognito mode, or use Chrome browser.

sources.title: How to create a resume for a job from Job Search results
sources.summary: From the Job Search page, click any job listing to view details. Click the Create Resume for This Job button—we automatically extract all requirements from that posting and generate a targeted resume in 30-60 seconds. Then edit if needed, download as PDF or Word, and click Apply to go to the employer's application page.

failures.reason: Expected title "Fix white screen or blank page not loading" not found in top 3 sources. Got: Fix white screen or blank page, What to do if you do not have a job description, What processing means and how long resume analysis takes

failures.testName: PHASE 2: WHITE SCREEN: page is empty

expected.expectedTitle: Fix white screen or blank page not loading

sources.title: Fix white screen or blank page
sources.summary: A blank or white page usually means a browser compatibility issue or JavaScript error. Try refreshing, clearing cache, or using a different browser.

sources.title: How to download your resume as PDF or Word from the Results page
sources.summary: From the Results page, click the Download button and choose PDF or Word (DOCX) format. PDF is best for online applications and email. Word is best if you need to make additional edits in Microsoft Word or Google Docs.

sources.title: What is SPOR Analysis on the Results page
sources.summary: SPOR stands for Skills, Position, Optimization, and Recommendations. It is our methodology for measuring how well your resume matches a specific job. We analyze your skills fit, experience level, missing keywords, and provide specific improvement advice. Your overall score (0-100) reflects genuine match quality using O*NET government data.

sources.title: What does my resume score mean on the Results page
sources.summary: Your SPOR score (0-100) honestly reflects how well your resume matches the target job. Scores 70+ mean genuinely qualified. Scores 50-69 mean partial match with gaps. Scores below 50 indicate significant gaps—we explain exactly what is missing and suggest alternatives. A low score is valuable feedback, not failure.

sources.title: Fix white screen or blank page not loading
sources.summary: A blank page usually means a browser compatibility issue. Try: hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows, Cmd+Shift+R on Mac), clear browser cache, disable extensions (especially ad blockers), try Incognito mode, or use Chrome browser.

failures.reason: Expected title "Fix white screen or blank page not loading" not found in top 3 sources. Got: Fix white screen or blank page, How to download your resume as PDF or Word from the Results page, What is SPOR Analysis on the Results page

failures.testName: PHASE 2: STUCK SPINNING: stuck spinning forever

expected.expectedTitle: Fix stuck spinning or loading forever after Submit

sources.title: Fix stuck spinning or processing forever
sources.summary: If your resume is stuck processing for more than 2 minutes, try refreshing the page. Normal processing takes 30-60 seconds. Extended delays may indicate a temporary server issue.

sources.title: What processing means and how long resume analysis takes
sources.summary: When you see 'Processing' after submitting, we are running SPOR analysis—parsing your resume, analyzing the job description, cross-referencing O*NET data, and generating your optimized resume. This typically takes 30-60 seconds. If stuck over 2 minutes, refresh the page.

sources.title: Fix upload errors
sources.summary: Common upload errors include unsupported file types, files too large, or corrupted files. Here is how to troubleshoot upload issues.

sources.title: Fix upload failed or file rejected error on Submit page
sources.summary: Upload failures are usually caused by unsupported file types (only PDF/DOC/DOCX/TXT work), files over 5MB, corrupted files, or password-protected PDFs. Try saving as a different format or use the Paste Text option instead.

sources.title: Fix stuck spinning or loading forever after Submit
sources.summary: Normal processing takes 30-60 seconds. If stuck loading over 2 minutes: refresh the page (F5), check your internet connection, try a different browser. Do not click Submit again—this creates duplicates. Your submission is saved and will appear on Dashboard.

failures.reason: Expected title "Fix stuck spinning or loading forever after Submit" not found in top 3 sources. Got: Fix stuck spinning or processing forever, What processing means and how long resume analysis takes, Fix upload errors

sources.title: Fix stuck spinning or processing forever

sources.title: Where to find your results on the Results page after submission
sources.summary: After submitting, you are automatically redirected to the Results page showing your SPOR score. If you navigated away, click Results or My Resumes in the top navigation, or go to your Dashboard and click on any submission to view its results.

sources.title: Upload a resume
sources.summary: Learn how to upload your resume to ResumeCoach for analysis. We support PDF, DOC, DOCX, and TXT files up to 5MB. Most resumes are processed within 30 seconds.

sources.title: How to create a new resume for a different job from your existing profile
sources.summary: From the Dashboard, click New Resume or Create New to start a new submission. Your work history is already saved in your profile—just enter a new job description or use Job Search to find a new listing. We generate a fresh resume optimized for that different job.

sources.title: Fix 500 or 404 errors
sources.summary: A 500 error means a server-side issue - please try again in a few minutes. A 404 error means the page does not exist - check the URL or navigate from the homepage.

sources.title: Fix upload failed or file rejected error on Submit page
sources.summary: Upload failures are usually caused by unsupported file types (only PDF/DOC/DOCX/TXT work), files over 5MB, corrupted files, or password-protected PDFs. Try saving as a different format or use the Paste Text option instead.

sources.title: What processing means and how long resume analysis takes
sources.summary: When you see 'Processing' after submitting, we are running SPOR analysis—parsing your resume, analyzing the job description, cross-referencing O*NET data, and generating your optimized resume. This typically takes 30-60 seconds. If stuck over 2 minutes, refresh the page.

sources.title: Fix 500 error or Something went wrong server error
sources.summary: A 500 error means something went wrong on our servers—not caused by you. Wait 2-3 minutes and try again. If it persists over 10 minutes, submit a support ticket with: the exact URL, what action you attempted, the time it happened, and the full error message.

sources.title: Fix 500 or 404 errors
sources.summary: A 500 error means a server-side issue - please try again in a few minutes. A 404 error means the page does not exist - check the URL or navigate from the homepage.

sources.title: Fix job search showing no results or wrong results
sources.summary: If Job Search returns no results: try broader search terms, check your spelling, use common job titles, and try a larger location area. If results seem wrong, the search uses Google Jobs which may include related roles.

sources.title: What to do if you do not have a job description
sources.summary: You have three options: (1) Enter just the job title and we search Indeed for matching descriptions, (2) Use the Job Search page to find real listings and click Create Resume for This Job, or (3) Describe the role yourself. Real job postings produce better keyword matches than generic titles.

sources.title: How to improve your resume score on the Results page
sources.summary: To improve your score: provide a complete job description (not just title), ensure your profile lists all relevant skills and achievements with specific numbers, and verify the role matches your experience level. Review the Recommendations section on Results for specific improvement guidance.

sources.title: Fix 404 page not found error
sources.summary: A 404 error means that specific page does not exist. Check the URL for typos. Navigate fresh from the Dashboard or homepage instead of using old bookmarks. Old links from emails or expired pages may no longer work.

sources.title: How to apply to a job using the Apply button
sources.summary: After downloading your optimized resume, click the Apply button on the Results page or Job details page. This opens the employer's application page in a new tab. Upload your downloaded resume and complete their application form.

sources.title: How the AI Coach helps during resume submission
sources.summary: The AI Coach is the chat interface that guides you through the submission process. It can answer questions about what to enter, help you understand options, and explain features. Type your questions in the chat to get immediate help.

failures.testName: PHASE 3: DASHBOARD TRACKING: how do I see all my resumes
failures.query: how do I see all my resumes

expected.expectedTitle: How to view and track your job applications on the Dashboard

sources.title: How to access and reuse a previous resume from the Dashboard
sources.summary: Go to the Dashboard to see all your previous resume submissions. Click any card to open that resume. You can view the results, edit it again, download it in PDF or Word, or use it as reference for a new application.

sources.title: Why you need a different resume for every job application
sources.summary: One generic resume does not work because Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) scan for job-specific keywords. Each job posting uses different terminology, so each application needs a resume tailored to that exact job description. ResumeCoach stores your work history once and generates a fresh, keyword-optimized resume for each job you apply to.

sources.title: How to improve your resume score on the Results page
sources.summary: To improve your score: provide a complete job description (not just title), ensure your profile lists all relevant skills and achievements with specific numbers, and verify the role matches your experience level. Review the Recommendations section on Results for specific improvement guidance.

sources.title: What processing means and how long resume analysis takes
sources.summary: When you see 'Processing' after submitting, we are running SPOR analysis—parsing your resume, analyzing the job description, cross-referencing O*NET data, and generating your optimized resume. This typically takes 30-60 seconds. If stuck over 2 minutes, refresh the page.

sources.title: How to upgrade your plan from the Billing page
sources.summary: Click Pricing in the navigation or go to Account Settings > Billing. Click Upgrade on your desired plan and enter payment details. The upgrade takes effect immediately—additional resume credits are available right away.
